subject: Photography
title: How the Internet Changed Photography
description: A quick win: understand How the Internet Changed Photography.

hook.text: Before the internet, sharing photos meant prints in albums. Now billions of images are shared daily online.

buildup.text: Flickr, launched in 2004, was the first major platform for sharing and discovering photography online.

discovery.text: Online sharing created global photography communities. A photographer in Tokyo could inspire one in SÃ£o Paulo.

twist.text: Constant sharing created comparison culture. Photographers began measuring success in likes instead of craft.

climax.text: The internet gave photographers an audience of billions. It also drowned individual voices in a flood of content.

punchline.text: Everyone can show their work now. Standing out is harder than ever.
